intro: Murdannia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or along stream banks. Murdannia bracteata is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
